backend_priorities: 1. Primary: Minimize total cost at scale
notes.screen_connections: The screens section defines navigation flow - each screen's number, platform type, and connections_to array showing which screens it can navigate to

non_negotiables: Exactly one NavigationContainer at app root (App.tsx).
All navigators live in /navigation. Screens are pure views.
Routes are generated from screens[].number; route names are stable like 'S1', 'S2', ...
connections_to defines allowed navigation edges; do not add edges.
codegen_contract.react_navigation_stack: Use @react-navigation/native-stack for mobile unless spec requires otherwise.

design_specs.general_guidance: Make the design trendy, modern, eye catching, and consistent

screens.screen_function: This is the first screen on the website

spec_testing_guidance.overview: When building from these spec files, follow this testing guidance to ensure robust implementation.

mental_model.description: Use the interface promise mental model for testing
components: Public Inputs: Parameters passed to functions/APIs
Public Outputs: Return values, state changes, UI updates
Private Internals: Implementation details (ignore unless exposed)
mental_model.rule: Write tests to verify the promise of "given these inputs, produce these outputs" without testing internal mechanics.

1_unit_tests.description: Test individual functions and components in isolation
guidance: Mock all external dependencies (APIs, databases, services)
Test each function's inputs â†’ outputs contract
Cover edge cases: empty inputs, boundary values, invalid data
Test error handling and validation logic
Test API endpoints with actual database (use test database)
Verify data flows correctly between components
Test authentication/authorization flows end-to-end
Validate screen navigation matches connections_to arrays

3_api_contract_tests.description: Verify external API integrations work correctly
guidance: Mock external API responses for unit tests
Create contract tests that verify API shape hasn't changed
Test error scenarios: timeouts, rate limits, invalid responses
Validate API key/credential handling
Verify state updates correctly on user actions
Test optimistic updates and rollback scenarios
Validate state persistence (local storage, database)
Test state synchronization across components

5_ui_component_tests.description: Test visual components and user interactions
guidance: Test component renders correctly with various props
Verify user interactions trigger correct callbacks
Test loading, error, and empty states
Validate accessibility (screen readers, keyboard nav)

6_navigation_tests.description: Test screen flows match spec definitions
guidance: Verify each screen's connections_to navigations work
Test deep linking and URL routing
Validate navigation guards (auth required screens)
Test back navigation and history management

7_feature_placement_tests.description: Verify features appear on correct screens
guidance: Cross-reference spec positions with rendered screens
Test feature visibility based on user permissions
Validate grid_position guidance is reasonably followed
Test responsive behavior across screen sizes

8_backend_schema_tests.description: Test database operations and data integrity
guidance: Verify CRUD operations work correctly
Test Row Level Security (RLS) policies
Validate data migrations and schema changes
Test concurrent access and race conditions

implementation_priority: 1. Start with unit tests for core business logic
2. Add integration tests for critical user flows
3. Implement API contract tests for external services
4. Add UI tests for key user interactions
5. Expand coverage based on bug reports and edge cases

linking.notes: Enable later if needed; do not implement deep linking unless explicitly requested.
